clinical_study.official_title: Diphenhydramine 5% Ointment for Pain in Knee Osteoarthritis: a Randomised Double-blind Placebo-controlled Pilot Feasibility Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution, Research Institute of Fundamental and Clinical Immunology

clinical_study.source: Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution, Research Institute of Fundamental and Clinical Immunology

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate whether recruitment rates are adequate to power a future RCT. The secondary aims are to obtain preliminary information about safety and efficacy of topical diphenhydramine 5% ointment in patients with knee OA.

primary_outcome.description: Ability to recruit 8 patients per month

The Visual Analogue Scale for Pain varies from 0 to 10 cm. Higher values represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) - subscale Pain
secondary_outcome.description: KOOS Pain consists of 9 items, which are answered on a 4-point likert scale (0=no problems, 4=extreme problems). Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems..

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) - subscale Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: KOOS Symptoms consists of 7 items, which are answered on a 4-point likert scale (0=no problems, 4=extreme problems). Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) - subscale Activities of daily living (ADL)
secondary_outcome.description: KOOS ADL consists of 17 items, which are answered on a 4-point likert scale (0=no problems, 4=extreme problems). Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) - subscale of function in sports and recreation (Sport/Rec)
secondary_outcome.description: KOOS Sport/Rec consists of 5 items, which are answered on a 4-point likert scale (0=no problems, 4=extreme problems). Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) - subscale of quality of life (QOL)
secondary_outcome.description: KOOS QOL subscale of quality of life consists of 4 items, which are answered on a 4-point likert scale (0=no problems, 4=extreme problems). Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analogue Scale for patient global assessment
secondary_outcome.description: The Visual Analogue Scale for patient global assessment varies from 0 to 10 cm. Higher values represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global evaluation of treatment by patient
secondary_outcome.description: Global evaluation of treatment by patient on 5 point Likert scale. The Global Evaluation of treatment varies from 0 to 5. Higher values represent worse outcomes.

arm_group.description: Topical 5% diphenhydramine ointment applied at knee joint at a dose of 2 g three times a day for 7 days
Vehicle (placebo) ointment applied at knee joint at a dose of 2 g three times a day for 7 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ACR clinical criteria of knee OA
2. Radiographic knee OA (Kellgren-Lawrence grade >1)
3. Age â‰¥ 50 years
4. VAS pain >= 40/100 mm at baseline
5. Non-use of NSAIDs one week before the baseline
6. Symptoms present on most days for at least 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any form of inflammatory arthritis
2. Use of another topical product at the application site
3. Treatment with intraarticular hyaluronic acid within 6 months
4. Treatment with intraarticular glucocorticoid within 2 months
5. Knee injury/surgery or diagnostic arthroscopy within 3 months
6. Allergic reaction to diphenhydramine or any component of the formulation
7. Participant has clinical signs and symptoms suggestive of COVID-19, eg, fever, dry cough, dyspnea, sore throat, fatigue or confirmed infection by appropriate laboratory test within the last 4 weeks prior to Screening
